attributes.action: Regulate fireworks - allow them on set dates and between certain times only.
attributes.additional_details:
Loud fireworks cause a lot of distress - they terrify pets; can be difficult for people on the autistic spectrum; and disrupt sleep.  Yet they traditionally mark celebrations and bring joy too. However, we have slipped into a situation where we effectively have an Oct to Jan 'firework season': in the last 3 weeks, there have been fireworks every night.  

We need to find a balance between celebration and distress.  

Regulating dates/times and promoting silent fireworks is a good compromise.
attributes.background: There are many petitions asking for a complete ban on fireworks.  A better approach is for them to be regulated - many countries do this very successfully.  They could be allowed on days such as 5th November, Diwali, New Years' Eve, between certain times.  Silent fireworks could be exempt.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Review and reduce the decibel limit on fireworks sold to the public
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

Make it illegal for fireworks to be set off on days other than Nov 5 and Dec 31
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559397

Amend the law so that fireworks can not be used after 9pm from October to March
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560791

Ban the release of fireworks after 10pm, including on bonfire night
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557153
